moves.1. e4:
I usually play d4 first move but recently i saw a beautiful game with a variation in king's gambit that i never saw before: 3.Bc4 instead of Nf3.
I thought that in king's gambit not to play 3.Nf3 is madness.I already won 2 or 3 games with this variation and lost only one.I like it very much because it leads to open game with great attacking potential from both sides.
So i start with e4 and hope for e5
moves.3. Bc4: As I said, I thought that anything else than Nf3 is suicide but apparently it isn't :)
moves.3... Bc5:
In the game that made me fall in love with this variation, 3rd move from black is Qh4  and Bc5 is 4th move
continued with 5. d4
moves.4. Bxf7+ Kxf7 5. Qh5+ g6 6. Qd5+: I was hoping that he'll move the king to f8 maybe and then i can take the bishop with tempo, i had nothing to lose with this move, just postponing on taking the bishop
moves.6... Kg7 7. Qxc5 d6 8. Qc4: f7 square is very important for my attack because i'll try to castle and open up f file for my rook
moves.8... Nf6 9. Nf3 h6 10. d4 g5: protecting f-pawn, it took him 2 moves to do that
moves.11. Nc3: don't know why i made that move... 0-0 was better
moves.11... Re8: first sign of aggression from him
moves.12. e5 Bf5: can't take the knight because the pawn is pinned
moves.13. O-O Ne4 14. Nh4:
my first try to open up the f file
if he takes then 15. Rxf4 an from my analysis the worst case scenario for me is winning a pawn which isn't so bad :)
moves.14... Bh7:
he decides not to take it and moves the bishop to safety
maybe Be6 is better here, attacking my queen
moves.15. Bxf4: ok, time for the second try
moves.15... Nxc3: not  accepting the sacrifice again, but the file is open now
moves.16. Bxg5 hxg5: he finally accepts the sacrifice and it allows me a nice cobination for the end
moves.17. Rf7+ Kh8:
this or Kh6 is pretty much the same
he can hold it a little longer by playing Kg8 but the result is the same-->checkmate
moves.19. Qf7+:
and he resigns
if Kh8 -> Ng6#
if Kh6 -> Qg6#

for the next few games king's gambit is my openning :)
